required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Experience of Using Lipano in Children With Fatty Acid Oxidation Disorders
clinical_study.official_title: Experience of Using Lipano in Children With LCHAD (Long Chain Fatty Acid Oxidation Disorder)

brief_summary.textblock: This is a market research, observational study to evaluate the tolerability and acceptability of an MCT based formula for infants and young people with long chain fatty acid oxidation disorder from birth to 18 months. Patients with a confirmed diagnosis of a fatty acid oxidation disorder, which requires a specialist diet including MCT will be included in this study

primary_outcome.description: Daily questionnaire detailing any GI symptoms, severity and change from usual The collection of daily data about the gastrointestinal tolerance of the product
Daily questionnaire on amounts offered and amounts actually consumed, compared to recommended amount.
Questionnaire data captured to evaluate taste
Brief tick-box questionnaire on overall liking and acceptability of product

secondary_outcome.description: weight in g monitored to check growth
height in cm monitored to check growth

arm_group.description: Kanso Lipano will be consumed daily for 3 months each to assess tolerability and compliance

intervention.description: Subjects will be asked to take an MCT infant formula to assess the tolerability, compliance and overall acceptability of the product for patient with LCHAD

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of a fatty acid oxidation disorder requiring a ketogenic or a specialist diet as part of their treatment, which includes MCT.
- Patients from birth to 18 months
- Written informed consent obtained from patient or parental caregiver
Exclusion Criteria:
- Presence of serious concurrent illness
- Investigator's uncertainty about the willingness or ability of the patient to comply with the protocol requirements
- Participation in any other studies involving investigational or marketed products concomitantly or within two weeks prior to entry into the study.
- Any patients having taken antibiotics over the previous 2 weeks leading up to the study
- Patients over 18 months of age

facility.name: Russian Children's Hospital Center for Orphan Diseases

patient_data.ipd_description: This study will be used to demonstrate acceptability for registration and reimbursement of these foods for special medical purposes.
